description: When Canada’s Prime Minister Justin Trudeau told a group of executives that President Donald Trump wasn’t kidding about annexing Canada, he offered one reason: critical minerals.
title: Why Trump Wants Canada’s Wealth of Critical Minerals

description: President Donald Trump, Vice President JD Vance and billionaire Elon Musk are calling for Marko Elez, the staffer who quit the Department of Government Efficiency after a report linking him to racism and eugenics, to return to his federal government job.
title: Trump, Musk Want to Rehire DOGE Staffer Linked to Racist Posts

description: The Trump administration approved the sale of more than $7.4 billion in weapons to Israel, reinforcing Washington’s commitment to arming its top Middle Eastern ally despite global criticism over its actions in Gaza and Lebanon.
title: US to Sell Israel $7.4 Billion Worth of Bombs, Hellfire Missiles

description: President Donald Trump asked the Department of Justice to review firearms rules and regulations drafted by former President Joe Biden’s administration, setting up a likely reversal of many of those policies.
title: Trump Signs Order Aimed at Undoing Biden Actions on Guns

description: Two days after Attorney General Pam Bondi ended a Biden administration program targeting wealthy Russians over the war in Ukraine, Justice Department lawyers argued to hold onto one of its most visible trophies, a $300 million superyacht seized in 2022.
title: DOJ Fights to Keep $300 Million Russian Superyacht After Folding Seizure Unit

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Moves at Warp Speed and World Feels the Shockwaves

description: US President Donald Trump signed an executive order Friday targeting South Africa over what his administration and allies allege are human rights violations stemming from a land expropriation law, escalating his dispute with the country.
title: Trump Signs Executive Order Targeting South Africa Over Land Law

description: Former Credit Suisse Chief Executive Officer Tidjane Thiam has given up his French citizenship as he prepares to run in Ivory Coast’s presidential elections slated for October.
title: Ivorian Presidential Hopeful Thiam Gives Up French Citizenship

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said his team was working with US counterparts to coordinate with Donald Trump’s administration, after the US president suggested earlier Friday he’d be willing to meet.
title: Zelenskiy Says Working With Trump’s Team, Seeking Deal With US

description: President Donald Trump said he planned to fire “some” but not all of the FBI employees who were involved in the criminal prosecutions of his supporters in connection with the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol.
title: Trump Says He’ll Fire ‘Some’ FBI Agents Who Handled Jan. 6 Cases

description: Two House Democrats are questioning a $49,900 “emergency” paint job for Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s government-supplied home, seeking to capitalize on the expense as antithetical to Donald Trump’s cost-cutting drive.
title: Democrats Question $49,900 Bill for Painting Hegseth’s Military Housing

description: President Donald Trump said that the US and Japan are discussing a pipeline project in Alaska after meeting with the country’s prime minister, Shigeru Ishiba.
title: Trump Says He Discussed LNG Exports With Japan’s Ishiba

description: The Trump administration told the US Supreme Court that states can constitutionally ban gender-affirming treatments for minors, flipping the federal government’s position in a high-profile case.
title: Trump Backs Trans-Care Ban, Flips US Position at Supreme Court

description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott is amplifying his push for the state to play a bigger role in finance, from equity trading to business incorporations.
title: Texas Governor Fans New York Rivalry With Stock Exchange Boost

description: After President Donald Trump has taken steps to access and even remove data at federal agencies, statisticians are sounding the alarm that economic numbers need to be protected.
title: Trump Attack on Bureaucracy Raises Concerns Over ‘Gold Standard’ Economic Data

description: Finland said a Russian state aircraft is suspected of having violated its airspace.
title: Finland Says Russian Aircraft Suspected of Violating Airspace

description: Edward Coristine posted online that he had retained access to the firm’s servers. Now he has access to sensitive government information.
title: Musk’s DOGE Teen Was Fired By Cybersecurity Firm for Leaking Company Secrets

description: Senator Ron Wyden on Friday accused the Treasury Department of misleading Congress about the level of access into sensitive payment systems the administration has granted to allies of billionaire Elon Musk.
title: Bessent Misled Congress About DOGE Access, Senate Democrat Says

description: A former SpaceX intern working with Elon Musk’s efficiency team has been granted access to the Energy Department’s information technology systems, despite objections from the agency’s general counsel and chief information offices, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: DOGE Accesses Energy Department Data, But Not ‘Nuclear Secrets’

description: The US government reached a temporary agreement Friday not to make public a list of FBI agents, analysts and support staff who helped investigate the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol by President Donald Trump’s supporters.
title: US Agrees to Keep List of Jan. 6  FBI Employees Secret for Now

description: Tens of thousands of Slovaks protested against Prime Minister Robert Fico’s government in more than 40 cities Friday, seeking to defend the country’s pro-European alignment.
title: Slovakia’s Fico Faces Renewed Protests Against Pro-Russian Drift

description: UK Foreign Secretary David Lammy warned President Donald Trump against cutting foreign aid programs, saying when Britain took similar actions, it had been a “big strategic mistake.”
title: UK’s Lammy Warns Donald Trump Against Cutting Foreign Aid

description: Booz Allen Hamilton Holding Corp., a US government defense contractor, is ending its diversity, equity and inclusion programs, citing President Donald Trump’s executive order pressuring federal suppliers to cancel diversity practices.
title: Booz Allen Scraps DEI Programs in Reaction to Trump Orders

description: President Donald Trump signaled his continued opposition to Nippon Steel Corp.’s proposed purchase of United States Steel Corp., as he met with Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, dampening hopes among the deal’s advocates that he might help revive a transaction blocked by his predecessor.
title: Trump Is Still Opposed to Nippon Steel Takeover of US Steel

description: President Donald Trump said he would maintain the duty-free exception for low-value packages coming from China until “adequate systems are in place to fully and expediently process and collect tariff revenue,” formalizing a temporary reprieve to retailers like Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and JD.com Inc.
title: Trump Delays Suspension of Duty-Free Exception on Chinese Goods

description: President Donald Trump said he plans to unveil reciprocal tariffs next week in a major escalation of his trade war with US economic partners.
title: Trump Says He Will Announce Reciprocal Tariffs Next Week

description: Alaska Senator Lisa Murkowski says she completely understands Canadians’ “sense of betrayal” from President Donald Trump’s tariff threats, but that his demands for the northern nation to boost its border security and military spending are valid.
title: Alaska Senator Says She Understands Canadians Feeling Betrayed by Trump

description: The UK government has ordered Apple Inc. to build a backdoor to give it access to global user data, in a move that could spark one of the biggest privacy fights in the iPhone maker’s history.
title: Apple Ordered by UK to Build Backdoor to Access User Data

description: The president wants to renew his signature 2017 tax overhaul, which expires at the end of the year.
title: What to Know About Trump’s Plan to Extend Tax Cuts

description: The US dollar rose to the day’s high on uncertainty surrounding President Donald Trump’s plans to implement tariffs, sending global currency peers sliding.
title: Dollar Climbs to Day’s High as Traders Speculate on Tariffs

description: The Canadian federal government suppressed a chatbot application released last month by Chinese software company DeepSeek.
title: Canada Bans DeepSeek Chatbot Application on Government Devices

description: President Donald Trump aims to address what the administration casts as unfair taxation of US firms abroad as he pursues an overhaul of trade and tax policy in his second term, according to one of his top economic advisers.
title: Trump Aide Hassett Says US Aims to Level Playing Field on Taxes

description: In the face of tariff threats from the Trump administration, Canadian leaders gathered Friday to map out a strategy for shifting exports from the US to other markets — even if some think that effort is coming too late.
title: CEOs, Trudeau Try to Plot Canadian Export Strategy That Looks Beyond US

description: Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency has embedded itself inside the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, the first step toward dismantling the agency.
title: Musk’s DOGE Descends on CFPB With Eyes on Shutting It Down

description: Linda McMahon, President Donald Trump’s pick to lead the Department of Education, plans to forfeit a stock award from Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. if confirmed.
title: Linda McMahon Plans to Forfeit Trump Media Stock Award If Confirmed

description: Guatemala is dipping into government coffers to boost spending on job creation and social programs as it braces for a spike in deportations from the US.
title: Guatemala to Boost Spending to Absorb Spike in Deportations From US

description: President Donald Trump’s tax cut wish list would cost would the federal government between $5 trillion and $11.2 trillion in lost revenue over the next decade, according to a new analysis from a budget watchdog group.
title: Trump Tax Cuts’ Cost Estimated at $5 Trillion to $11 Trillion

description: Bolivia’s government has defended the legality of domestically produced gold purchased by the central bank, following allegations by opposition lawmakers that the practice may constitute gold laundering.
title: Bolivia Defends Central Bank Gold Buying Against Laundering Accusations

description: Israel has identified an airport and seaport as potential departure points for Palestinians from war-ravaged Gaza, according to a draft plan presented to Defense Minister Israel Katz on how to implement US President Donald Trump’s controversial proposal.
title: Israel Drafts Plans to Allow Gazans Passage Via Ports, Borders

description: The US call for conciliation may be landing at the right time for the Islamic Republic with the country weakened economically and militarily.
title: As Trump Makes Overtures, Iran Weighs Its Next Move

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has appointed his former ambassador to Washington as the UK’s special envoy to the Western Balkans, as the government seeks to show more progress in its efforts to curb the flow of asylum-seekers via Europe.
title: UK Names Ex-Washington Envoy to Help Curb Migration Via Europe

description: President Donald Trump announced he was ordering a review of funding for all nongovernmental organizations and planned to cancel support for groups his administration deems are not working in the interests of the US.
title: Trump Orders Federal Agencies to Review All Funding for NGOs

description: President Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba will discuss bolstering foreign investment in the US, including cooperation on defense, artificial intelligence, semiconductors and cybersecurity, according to senior administration officials.
title: Trump, Ishiba to Discuss Cooperation on AI, Chips in First Meet

description: The tariffs President Donald Trump threatened against Canada, Mexico and China over the weekend roiled financial markets but they fall far short of duties the US would need to offset the cost of extending his expiring 2017 tax cuts, economists estimate.
title: Trump’s Threatened Tariffs Fall Far Short of Paying for Tax Cuts

description: Zimbabwe has started paying reparations to nations and farmers whose land was seized in the 2000s, a step toward the restructuring of its $21 billion debt pile.
title: Zimbabwe Starts Paying for Farms It Seized to Meet Compensation Deal

description: The European Union is discussing a deal to partially suspend several sanctions on Syria’s energy industry, including scrapping bans on importing crude from the country and on exporting technologies to the oil and gas industry.
title: EU Weighs Suspending Sanctions on Syria’s Oil Industry and Banks

description: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights urged “all those with influence” to move quickly to end the deadly violence in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo and stop it from exploding into a regional war.
title: UN Rights Chief Asks Anyone With ‘Influence’ to Act on Congo

description: South Africa’s fractious coalition government has finally found common cause: opposition to the Trump administration’s attempt to export its war on diversity to a country still dealing with the legacy of apartheid.
title: Trump’s Barbs Unite Fractious South African Coalition Government

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attempt to iron out issues related to bilateral trade and seek US investments in India’s civil nuclear energy when he meets President Donald Trump next week.
title: Modi to Prioritize Trade in Discussions With Trump Next Week

description: Iran has faced suspicion for decades over its nuclear ambitions and whether it’s developing the capability to fire an atomic weapon.
title: How Close Is Iran to a Nuclear Weapon as Trump Eyes a Deal?

description: A US aircraft carrier strike group left the Red Sea for Europe weeks after Yemen’s Houthi rebel group said it will stop attacking vessels in the region.
title: US Aircarft Carrier Leaves Red Sea as Houthis Pause Attacks

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Modi Heads to the US Bearing Gifts for Trump

description: Freezing aid funds jeopardizes critical healthcare programs and security cooperation with important US allies around the world
title: USAID Cuts in Kenya Reveal Risks to Lives and American Influence Worldwide

description: Singapore-listed oil production company Interra Resources said it is seeking legal advice to determine whether its subsidiaries violated foreign laws in supplying oil to military-controlled Myanmar.
title: Singapore Firm Seeks Legal Advice Over Supplying Oil to Myanmar

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said he plans to impose sanctions against independent media and civil society groups that accept foreign funding, in an escalation of a long-running campaign to suppress dissenting voices before key elections.
title: Orban Seeks to Channel Trump in Sweeping Crackdown Before Ballot

description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said talks with the US would be “unwise and dishonorable” after President Donald Trump said he wanted a new nuclear deal with the Islamic Republic.
title: Iran’s Khamenei Says Trump’s Past Makes It Unwise to Talk to US

description: Support for Germany’s conservative opposition gained slightly in a new poll, suggesting CDU leader Friedrich Merz’s controversial push for tougher migration rules hasn’t hurt his election prospects.
title: German Conservatives Extend Lead Over Far Right in Election Poll

description: One of the two ruling parties in Greenland wants the Arctic island to hold a referendum on independence from Denmark already in the next parliamentary term, its leader said in a broadcast interview with DR.
title: Greenland Ruling Party Seeks Independence Vote by 2029

description: Germany’s goods-trade surplus with the US hit a new high last year, a development that’s likely to irk President Donald Trump just as he threatens tariffs on Europe.
title: Germany’s Record Trade Surplus With US Set to Stoke Tensions

description: The Trump administration’s campaign to root out perceived disloyalty or waste at the Justice Department, the US Agency for International Development and other federal agencies has lawmakers and former senior spy officials worried that the intelligence community is up next for a purge.
title: US Spy World Worries It May Be Next for Trump’s DOGE-Led Purges

description: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte said her lawyers are preparing to fight the impeachment case, signaling she’s ready to defend herself as her feud with President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. intensifies.
title: Philippine Vice President Duterte Vows to Fight Impeachment Case

description: Former Singapore transport minister S Iswaran will serve the remainder of his 12-month jail sentence in home detention, the nation’s prison service said.
title: Singapore’s Ex-Transport Minister Iswaran on Home Detention, CNA Reports

description: President Donald Trump’s first sanctions package targeting a handful of vessels carrying Iranian oil stopped short of the “maximum pressure” campaign his administration had pledged, according to shippers and analysts.
title: Trump’s Iranian Sanctions Hit Three Ships Active in China Trade

description: Malaysia’s king, Sultan Ibrahim Iskandar, has left the country for medical treatment, according to his official Facebook page.
title: Malaysia Billionaire King Ibrahim Seeks Medical Treatment Abroad

description: Senior leaders at the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have been told to rank thousands of probationary employees based on how essential they are to operations as fears of mass layoffs ripple through the federal government.
title: CDC Leaders Told to Rank Thousands of Workers Amid Layoff Fears

description: The chairwoman of the Federal Election Commission posted a letter from President Donald Trump informing her that she’d been fired, but she’s refusing to leave.
title: Trump Fires Head of Federal Election Panel, But She Won’t Leave

description: The US Justice Department is appealing an order by a Seattle federal judge blocking President Donald Trump’s attempt to restrict automatic birthright citizenship.
title: Trump Administration Appeals Loss on Birthright Citizenship

description: The Trump administration has chosen Gerald Parker, a veterinarian and former top US health and security official, to lead the White House Office of Pandemic Preparedness and Response Policy, people familiar with the matter said Thursday.
title: Trump Team Taps Bird Flu Expert to Lead Pandemic Response Unit

description: President Donald Trump’s shutdown of the US Agency for International Development was challenged in court by unions representing federal employees, which say the freeze on foreign aid is causing a global humanitarian crisis and costing thousands of American jobs.
title: Trump’s Shutdown of USAID Challenged in Court by Worker Unions

description: Canada’s finance minister says he needs to take a hard look at the size of government as the country prepares for major new defense spending and a potential economic disruption from its largest trading partner.
title: LeBlanc Says Canada Should Spend Less, Review Government Size

description: The UK government published plans to make rental homes more energy-efficient by forcing landlords to make costly investments in insulation.
title: UK Landlords Face £6,800 Hit to Insulate Drafty Housing Stock

description: The British government’s reliance on carbon capture to cut emissions is a risky strategy that may heap costs on consumers in coming years, a Parliament committee said.
title: UK’s Carbon Capture Strategy Is ‘High Risk,’ Lawmakers Warn
